title: ABOUT
text:
Mathew Cieśla received his BA (cum laude) in psycholinguistics with a minor in German language and philology from New College at the University of Alabama. In 2022, he was given the prestigious Fulbright Award (independent research grant) by the U.S.-Polish Fulbright Commission to conduct research at Adam Mickiewicz University, Poznań. Here, he collaborated with Drs. Katarzyna Jankowiak and  Efthymia Kapnoual comparing neural responses to orthographic and image referents on early-stage second language acquisition. Currently, Mathew is working toward his Ph.D. as a postgraduate researcher at the Department of Psychology, Northumbria University Newcastle. He is supervised by Dr. Glenn Williams and co-supervised by Dr. Hazel Blythe and Dr. Vera Kempe.
